column4: hi all i am running ubuntu 8.04 on an amd64 with an nf4 mb and i am using the optical from the onboard sound going to my stereo and i dont hear any sound
i think i just need to adjust a setting
yea a couple times but i think i need to tell it to use pcm or something
can someone tell me what i need to do to get some sound
the motherboard is an asus a8n32-sli-deluxe with an alc850 sound chip using the optical out
try running alsamixer from a terminal and see if the slider is muted (press M to toggle) or turned down for the optical out
Are those the only ones you see? What does it say for Card: in th etop left?
I'm a recent convert as well. I find that there's no substitute for k3b and amarok though. Mostly amarok. Brasero isn't awful.
System sounds are enabled in the Sound preferences? You could also try changing the Sound Events playback from Autodetect to something else.
when i do the sound tests they play but i still dont hear anything when i do clicking
you have software mixing turned on?
heh..I dunno. I turn off system sounds because I don't like them.
